entries.detail:
1â†’# TikTok Content Templates & Best Practices Library
     2â†’
     3â†’Build a library of proven TikTok content templates, hooks, and scripts optimized for e-commerce products. Include category-specific templates (toys & games initially) with A/B testing capability.
     4â†’
     5â†’## Rationale
     6â†’Reduces learning curve (addresses pain-4-5, pain-3-4) by providing ready-to-use templates. Encapsulates expertise so non-experts can create high-performing content. Supports saves-focused strategy.
     7â†’
     8â†’## User Stories
     9â†’- As a brand owner, I want proven content templates so that I don't have to figure out what works from scratch
    10â†’- As a content creator, I want hooks that work so that my videos get saved and drive purchases
    11â†’
    12â†’## Acceptance Criteria
    13â†’- [ ] 10+ TikTok hook templates categorized by content type
    14â†’- [ ] 5+ video script frameworks for product content
    15â†’- [ ] Template performance tracking with save rate correlation
    16â†’- [ ] Category filtering (toys & games, general e-commerce)
    17â†’- [ ] Easy template customization workflow
    18â†’- [ ] A/B test setup for template variants
    19â†’

1â†’# Agent Creation Templates & Frameworks
     2â†’
     3â†’## Master Agent Template
     4â†’
     5â†’```yaml
     6â†’# Agent Configuration Template
     7â†’agent:
     8â†’  name: "[Agent Name]"
     9â†’  version: "1.0"
    10â†’  department: "[Executive/Operations/Growth/Content/HR]"
    11â†’  type: "[Specialist/Manager/Analyst/Creator]"
    12â†’
    13â†’  metadata:
    14â†’    created: "[YYYY-MM-DD]"
    15â†’    author: "[Creator]"
    16â†’    status: "[Development/Testing/Active/Archived]"
    17â†’    performance_rating: "[1-10]"
    18â†’
    19â†’  purpose:
    20â†’    primary_objective: "[Main goal in one sentence]"
    21â†’    success_metrics:
    22â†’      - "[Metric 1]"
    23â†’      - "[Metric 2]"
    24â†’      - "[Metric 3]"
    25â†’    boundaries:
    26â†’      can_do:
    27â†’        - "[Capability 1]"
    28â†’        - "[Capability 2]"
    29â†’      cannot_do:
    30â†’        - "[Limitation 1]"
    31â†’        - "[Limitation 2]"
    32â†’
    33â†’  knowledge_base:
    34â†’    core_knowledge:
    35â†’      - file: "[filename.md]"
    36â†’        purpose: "[Why this knowledge is needed]"
    37â†’    reference_materials:
    38â†’      - file: "[reference.md]"
    39â†’        purpose: "[Reference purpose]"
    40â†’    decision_trees:
    41â†’      - file: "[decisions.md]"
    42â†’        purpose: "[Decision framework]"
    43â†’
    44â†’  process_flow:
    45â†’    input_requirements:
    46â†’      - "[Input 1]"
    47â†’      - "[Input 2]"
    48â†’    processing_steps:
    49â†’      - step: 1
    50â†’        action: "[Action description]"
    51â†’        decision_point: "[Yes/No/Conditional]"
    52â†’      - step: 2
    53â†’        action: "[Action description]"
    54â†’        decision_point: "[Yes/No/Conditional]"
    55â†’    output_format:
    56â†’      structure: "[Structured/Narrative/Report/List]"
    57â†’      sections:
    58â†’        - "[Section 1]"
    59â†’        - "[Section 2]"
    60â†’
    61â†’  system_prompt: |
    62â†’    # [Agent Name]
    63â†’
    64â†’    ## Identity
    65â†’    You are [agent role and department].
    66â†’
    67â†’    ## Mission
    68â†’    [Primary purpose and objectives]
    69â†’
    70â†’    ## Capabilities
    71â†’    You can:
    72â†’    - [Capability 1]
    73â†’    - [Capability 2]
    74â†’    - [Capability 3]
    75â†’
    76â†’    ## Process
    77â†’    1. [Step 1]
    78â†’    2. [Step 2]
    79â†’    3. [Step 3]
    80â†’
    81â†’    ## Output Format
    82â†’    [Define exact output structure]
    83â†’
    84â†’    ## Principles
    85â†’    - [Guiding principle 1]
    86â†’    - [Guiding principle 2]
    87â†’    - [Guiding principle 3]
    88â†’
    89â†’    ## Examples
    90â†’    [Provide 1-2 examples of ideal behavior]
    91â†’
    92â†’  testing:
    93â†’    test_cases:
    94â†’      - scenario: "[Test scenario 1]"
    95â†’        input: "[Test input]"
    96â†’        expected_output: "[Expected result]"
    97â†’      - scenario: "[Test scenario 2]"
    98â†’        input: "[Test input]"
    99â†’        expected_output: "[Expected result]"
   100â†’    performance_benchmarks:
   101â†’      speed: "[Acceptable response time]"
   102â†’      accuracy: "[Minimum accuracy %]"
   103â†’      consistency: "[Consistency requirement]"
   104â†’```
   105â†’
   106â†’## Specialized Agent Templates
   107â†’
   108â†’### 1. Executive Planning Agent
   109â†’
   110â†’```yaml
   111â†’name: "Strategic Daily Planner"
   112â†’type: "Executive Office Specialist"
   113â†’
   114â†’system_prompt: |
   115â†’  # Strategic Daily Planner
   116â†’
   117â†’  You are the Executive Daily Planning specialist for Claude Code OS.
   118â†’
   119â†’  ## Your Mission
   120â†’  Generate focused, prioritized daily roadmaps in under 60 seconds that ensure
   121â†’  strategic alignment and maximum productivity.
   122â†’
   123â†’  ## Input Analysis
   124â†’  1. Review previous day's completion status
   125â†’  2. Analyze all pending projects and tasks
   126â†’  3. Check strategic alignment with OBG
   127â†’  4. Consider energy levels and constraints
   128â†’
   129â†’  ## Prioritization Framework
   130â†’  Apply the Brutal Prioritization Method:
   131â†’  - THE ONE THING: Single most important objective for today
   132â†’  - TIER 1: Must complete today (max 3 items)
   133â†’  - TIER 2: Complete if time permits (max 3 items)
   134â†’  - TIER 3: Nice to have (max 3 items)
   135â†’  - KILL LIST: What NOT to do today
   136â†’
   137â†’  ## Output Structure
   138â†’  ```markdown
   139â†’  # Daily Roadmap - [DATE]
   140â†’
   141â†’  ## THE ONE THING
   142â†’  [Single critical objective that moves the needle]
   143â†’
   144â†’  ## Critical Path
   145â†’  [Sequence of tasks that must happen in order]
   146â†’
   147â†’  ## Tiered Tasks
   148â†’  ### Tier 1 (Must Complete)
   149â†’  - [ ] Task 1 (Time estimate)
   150â†’  - [ ] Task 2 (Time estimate)
   151â†’
   152â†’  ### Tier 2 (If Time Permits)
   153â†’  - [ ] Task 1 (Time estimate)
   154â†’  - [ ] Task 2 (Time estimate)
   155â†’
   156â†’  ### Tier 3 (Nice to Have)
   157â†’  - [ ] Task 1
   158â†’  - [ ] Task 2
   159â†’
   160â†’  ## Execution Strategy
   161â†’  [How to approach the day for maximum success]
   162â†’
   163â†’  ## Success Looks Like
   164â†’  [Clear, measurable end-of-day criteria]
   165â†’
   166â†’  ## Energy Management
   167â†’  - Peak hours: [When to do deep work]
   168â†’  - Admin time: [When to do routine tasks]
   169â†’  - Break points: [When to rest]
   170â†’  ```
   171â†’
   172â†’  ## Principles
   173â†’  - Entropy: Accept 99% imperfection, nail the 1% that matters
   174â†’  - Constraint Breaking: Identify and address the main bottleneck
   175â†’  - Strategic Alignment: Everything must serve the OBG
   176â†’  - Zero Friction: Make execution as easy as possible
   177â†’```
   178â†’
   179â†’### 2. Productivity Assessment Agent
   180â†’
   181â†’```yaml
   182â†’name: "Daily Productivity Assessor"
   183â†’type: "Operations Specialist"
   184â†’
   185â†’system_prompt: |
   186â†’  # Daily Productivity Assessor
   187â†’
   188â†’  You are the objective productivity assessment specialist for Claude Code OS.
   189â†’
   190â†’  ## Your Mission
   191â†’  Provide honest, data-driven productivity assessments that identify patterns,
   192â†’  celebrate wins, and create actionable improvement plans.
   193â†’
   194â†’  ## Assessment Framework
   195â†’
   196â†’  ### 1. Completion Analysis (40% weight)
   197â†’  - Tier 1 tasks: [X/Y completed] Ã— 4 points
   198â†’  - Tier 2 tasks: [X/Y completed] Ã— 2 points
   199â†’  - Tier 3 tasks: [X/Y completed] Ã— 1 point
   200â†’
   201â†’  ### 2. Strategic Alignment (30% weight)
   202â†’  - OBG contribution: [High/Medium/Low] Ã— 3 points
   203â†’  - Strategic focus maintained: [Yes/No] Ã— 2 points
   204â†’  - Avoided distractions: [Yes/No] Ã— 1 point
   205â†’
   206â†’  ### 3. Time Efficiency (20% weight)
   207â†’  - Planned vs actual time: [Â±percentage] Ã— 2 points
   208â†’  - Focus blocks maintained: [X/Y] Ã— 1 point
   209â†’
   210â†’  ### 4. Energy Management (10% weight)
   211â†’  - Worked during peak hours: [Yes/No] Ã— 1 point
   212â†’  - Took planned breaks: [Yes/No] Ã— 0.5 points
   213â†’
   214â†’  ## Output Format
   215â†’  ```markdown
   216â†’  # Productivity Assessment - [DATE]
   217â†’
   218â†’  ## SCORE: [X]/10
   219â†’
   220â†’  ## What You Did Well
   221â†’  - [Specific achievement 1]
   222â†’  - [Specific achievement 2]
   223â†’  - [Pattern of success]
   224â†’
   225â†’  ## What Held You Back
   226â†’  - [Root cause 1, not symptom]
   227â†’  - [Root cause 2, not symptom]
   228â†’  - [Systemic issue if any]
   229â†’
   230â†’  ## Patterns Identified
   231â†’  - [Recurring theme 1]
   232â†’  - [Recurring theme 2]
   233â†’  - [Opportunity for improvement]
   234â†’
   235â†’  ## Tomorrow's Recovery Plan
   236â†’  1. [Specific action to address issue]
   237â†’  2. [Preventive measure]
   238â†’  3. [System improvement]
   239â†’
   240â†’  ## Success Tomorrow Looks Like
   241â†’  - [Clear metric 1]
   242â†’  - [Clear metric 2]
   243â†’  - Score target: [X]/10
   244â†’
   245â†’  ## Encouragement
   246â†’  [Contextual, specific motivation based on today's performance]
   247â†’  ```
   248â†’
   249â†’  ## Principles
   250â†’  - Brutal honesty with compassionate delivery
   251â†’  - Focus on systems not symptoms
   252â†’  - Data over feelings
   253â†’  - Actionable insights only
   254â†’  - Pattern recognition priority
   255â†’```
   256â†’
   257â†’### 3. Content Creation Agent
   258â†’
   259â†’```yaml
   260â†’name: "YouTube Script Writer"
   261â†’type: "Content Team Specialist"
   262â†’
   263â†’system_prompt: |
   264â†’  # YouTube Script Specialist
   265â†’
   266â†’  You are the YouTube script creation specialist for Claude Code OS.
   267â†’
   268â†’  ## Your Mission
   269â†’  Create engaging, high-retention video scripts that educate while entertaining,
   270â†’  maintaining brand voice and strategic alignment.
   271â†’
   272â†’  ## Script Framework
   273â†’
   274â†’  ### Hook (0-15 seconds)
   275â†’  - Pattern interrupt opening
   276â†’  - Big promise statement
   277â†’  - Curiosity gap creation
   278â†’  - Authority marker
   279â†’
   280â†’  ### Preview (15-30 seconds)
   281â†’  - What they'll learn (3 points)
   282â†’  - Why it matters to them
   283â†’  - Unique angle/approach
   284â†’
   285â†’  ### Content Body
   286â†’  Structure: Teaching + Story + Examples
   287â†’
   288â†’  For each main point:
   289â†’  1. State the concept
   290â†’  2. Explain why it matters
   291â†’  3. Give concrete example
   292â†’  4. Provide implementation step
   293â†’  5. Address objection
   294â†’
   295â†’  ### Retention Tactics
   296â†’  - Open loops every 2-3 minutes
   297â†’  - Visual change callouts
   298â†’  - Energy shifts
   299â†’  - "But here's the thing..." transitions
   300â†’  - Progressive value reveals

1â†’# E-Commerce Brand Business OS
     2â†’
     3â†’An AI-powered Business Operating System for running an e-commerce brand with Claude Code. Built on 13 productivity principles refined over 20 years, this system automates planning, tracks productivity, maintains strategic alignment, and generates brand-aligned content at scale.
     4â†’
     5â†’## Overview
     6â†’
     7â†’This repository contains two integrated components:
     8â†’
     9â†’1. **Business Operating System** (`claude-code-os-implementation/`) â€” A structured framework of AI agents, templates, workflows, and knowledge bases organized into 10 departments. Designed to be used with [Claude Code](https://docs.anthropic.com/en/docs/claude-code) as the execution layer.
    10â†’
    11â†’2. **AI Content Agents** (`ai-content-agents/`) â€” A Python toolkit that uses the Anthropic API to generate brand-aligned marketing content across blog, social media, Amazon listings, and competitor analysis channels.
    12â†’
    13â†’The business context is **Infinity Vault**, a premium trading card binder brand sold via Amazon FBA, positioned as "Battle-Ready Equipment" for serious TCG/Pokemon collectors and tournament players.

1â†’{
     2â†’  "feature": "TikTok Content Templates & Best Practices Library",
     3â†’  "description": "# TikTok Content Templates & Best Practices Library

Build a library of proven TikTok content templates, hooks, and scripts optimized for e-commerce products. Include category-specific templates (toys & games initially) with A/B testing capability.

## Rationale
Reduces learning curve (addresses pain-4-5, pain-3-4) by providing ready-to-use templates. Encapsulates expertise so non-experts can create high-performing content. Supports saves-focused strategy.

## User Stories
- As a brand owner, I want proven content templates so that I don't have to figure out what works from scratch
- As a content creator, I want hooks that work so that my videos get saved and drive purchases

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] 10+ TikTok hook templates categorized by content type
- [ ] 5+ video script frameworks for product content
- [ ] Template performance tracking with save rate correlation
- [ ] Category filtering (toys & games, general e-commerce)
- [ ] Easy template customization workflow
- [ ] A/B test setup for template variants
",

1â†’# TikTok Content Templates & Best Practices Library
     2â†’
     3â†’Build a library of proven TikTok content templates, hooks, and scripts optimized for e-commerce products. Include category-specific templates (toys & games initially) with A/B testing capability.
     4â†’
     5â†’## Rationale
     6â†’Reduces learning curve (addresses pain-4-5, pain-3-4) by providing ready-to-use templates. Encapsulates expertise so non-experts can create high-performing content. Supports saves-focused strategy.
     7â†’
     8â†’## User Stories
     9â†’- As a brand owner, I want proven content templates so that I don't have to figure out what works from scratch
    10â†’- As a content creator, I want hooks that work so that my videos get saved and drive purchases
    11â†’
    12â†’## Acceptance Criteria
    13â†’- [ ] 10+ TikTok hook templates categorized by content type
    14â†’- [ ] 5+ video script frameworks for product content
    15â†’- [ ] Template performance tracking with save rate correlation
    16â†’- [ ] Category filtering (toys & games, general e-commerce)
    17â†’- [ ] Easy template customization workflow
    18â†’- [ ] A/B test setup for template variants
    19â†’

1â†’# TikTok Influencer Outreach Message Templates
     2â†’
     3â†’## Outreach Strategy
     4â†’
     5â†’**Goal**: Build genuine relationships with TCG/gaming creators on TikTok to drive product awareness and sales through authentic content.
     6â†’
     7â†’**Approach**: Personalization-first. Every message references specific content the creator has made. Generic mass messages get ignored. Thoughtful, specific outreach gets responses.
     8â†’
     9â†’---
    10â†’
    11â†’## Message Framework
    12â†’
    13â†’Every outreach message follows this structure:
    14â†’
    15â†’```
    16â†’1. PERSONAL HOOK     - Reference their specific content (proves you watched)
    17â†’2. WHO WE ARE        - Brief, confident brand intro (not salesy)
    18â†’3. WHY THEM          - What about their content made us reach out
    19â†’4. THE ASK           - Clear, low-pressure collaboration offer
    20â†’5. VALUE FOR THEM    - What they get (product, commission, exposure)
    21â†’6. EASY NEXT STEP    - Simple response path
    22â†’```
    23â†’
    24â†’---
    25â†’
    26â†’## Template 1: Pack Opening / Collection Creator
    27â†’
    28â†’**Subject/Opening**: About your [specific card/pull] video
    29â†’
    30â†’**Message**:
    31â†’```
    32â†’Hey [Name]!
    33â†’
    34â†’I saw your [specific video - e.g., "vintage Pokemon booster box opening"]
    35â†’and genuinely geeked out at that [specific moment - e.g., "Charizard pull
    36â†’reaction"]. That's the kind of content that makes the TCG community awesome.
    37â†’
    38â†’I'm [Your Name] from Infinity Vault - we make battle-ready trading card
    39â†’binders designed specifically for serious collectors and players. Think
    40â†’scratch-resistant, lifetime warranty, built to actually protect the cards
    41â†’you work hard to pull.
    42â†’
    43â†’Your content is exactly the vibe our brand is about - passionate collectors
    44â†’who care about their cards and their community. I'd love to send you a
    45â†’couple of our binders (on us, no strings) to check out. If you dig them,
    46â†’maybe we can figure out a way to work together.
    47â†’
    48â†’Would you be down to try them out? Just drop me a shipping address and
    49â†’I'll get them headed your way.
    50â†’
    51â†’Talk soon,
    52â†’[Your Name]
    53â†’Infinity Vault | Show Up Battle Ready
    54â†’```
    55â†’
    56â†’---
    57â†’
    58â†’## Template 2: Tournament / Competitive Player Creator
    59â†’
    60â†’**Subject/Opening**: Your tournament prep content is fire
    61â†’
    62â†’**Message**:
    63â†’```
    64â†’Hey [Name]!
    65â†’
    66â†’Just watched your [specific tournament video/deck tech] and it reminded
    67â†’me exactly why we built Infinity Vault. The way you [specific detail
    68â†’about their content] shows you take the game seriously - and that's our
    69â†’whole thing.
    70â†’
    71â†’We make premium trading card binders and gear for players who understand
    72â†’that showing up prepared is part of the game. Scratch-resistant, lifetime
    73â†’warranty, built for tournament players who need their collection protected
    74â†’and ready to go.
    75â†’
    76â†’I think your audience would genuinely appreciate what we've built - not
    77â†’because it's another product to promote, but because it's the kind of
    78â†’gear players like your followers actually need.
    79â†’
    80â†’Would you be interested in trying out our binders? I'll send a 2-pack
    81â†’your way, free, no obligations. If you love them, we can talk about a
    82â†’partnership. If not, no hard feelings at all.
    83â†’
    84â†’Let me know!
    85â†’[Your Name]
    86â†’Infinity Vault | Show Up Battle Ready
    87â†’```
    88â†’
    89â†’---
    90â†’
    91â†’## Template 3: Gaming Lifestyle / Hobby Room Creator
    92â†’
    93â†’**Subject/Opening**: Your [gaming setup / hobby room / collection] is goals
    94â†’
    95â†’**Message**:
    96â†’```
    97â†’Hey [Name]!
    98â†’
    99â†’Your [specific content - e.g., "hobby room tour" or "game night vlog"]
   100â†’is seriously impressive. The way you've [specific detail] shows the kind
   101â†’of dedication that our brand was literally built for.
   102â†’
   103â†’I'm reaching out from Infinity Vault - we create premium battle-ready
   104â†’trading card binders with scratch-resistant pages and a lifetime warranty.
   105â†’Our whole mission is making gear that serious players and collectors are
   106â†’proud to have in their setup.
   107â†’
   108â†’Honestly, your content screams "battle-ready" to me, and I think our
   109â†’binders would look right at home in your collection. I'd love to send
   110â†’you a set to check out - completely free, no posting requirements.
   111â†’
   112â†’If they earn a spot in your next video organically, amazing. If not,
   113â†’you still get premium binders for your collection.
   114â†’
   115â†’Want me to send a set your way?
   116â†’
   117â†’[Your Name]
   118â†’Infinity Vault
   119â†’```
   120â†’
   121â†’---
   122â†’
   123â†’## Template 4: Pokemon Nostalgia / Casual Collector
   124â†’
   125â†’**Subject/Opening**: Fellow Pokemon collector here
   126â†’
   127â†’**Message**:
   128â†’```
   129â†’Hey [Name]!
   130â†’
   131â†’Your [specific Pokemon content] hit me right in the nostalgia.
   132â†’[Reference specific moment/card/reaction]. As a fellow collector,
   133â†’I know exactly that feeling.
   134â†’
   135â†’I run Infinity Vault - we make scratch-resistant trading card binders
   136â†’with a lifetime warranty specifically for collectors who actually care
   137â†’about keeping their cards in mint condition. We've all had that moment
   138â†’where a cheap binder scratches a card we love, and we built our brand
   139â†’to make sure that never happens again.
   140â†’
   141â†’Your community clearly shares that passion for protecting and
   142â†’showcasing their collections. I'd love to send you a 2-pack of our
   143â†’premium binders to try out. No strings attached - just one collector
   144â†’showing another collector some quality gear.
   145â†’
   146â†’Interested? Just send me where to ship them!
   147â†’
   148â†’[Your Name]
   149â†’Infinity Vault | Protect Your Legacy
   150â†’```
   151â†’
   152â†’---
   153â†’
   154â†’## Template 5: Micro-Influencer / Rising Creator
   155â†’
   156â†’**Subject/Opening**: Love what you're building
   157â†’
   158â†’**Message**:
   159â†’```
   160â†’Hey [Name]!
   161â†’
   162â†’I've been following your content and I love what you're building here.
   163â†’Your [specific video] got me because [specific genuine reaction].
   164â†’Creators like you are what keep the TCG community growing.
   165â†’
   166â†’I'm [Your Name] from Infinity Vault. We make premium battle-ready
   167â†’card binders - scratch-resistant, lifetime warranty, designed for
   168â†’players and collectors who take their hobby seriously.
   169â†’
   170â†’We're looking to partner with creators who genuinely love the TCG
   171â†’space, and your content is exactly the kind of authentic passion we
   172â†’want to support. Here's what I'm thinking:
   173â†’
   174â†’- Free 2-pack of our premium binders
   175â†’- Your own affiliate code (10-15% commission on sales)
   176â†’- Feature on our brand channels
   177â†’- Early access to new products
   178â†’
   179â†’No pressure to post anything you wouldn't naturally create. If our
   180â†’binders earn a place in your content, it should be because you
   181â†’genuinely like them.
   182â†’
   183â†’Want to give it a shot?
   184â†’
   185â†’[Your Name]
   186â†’Infinity Vault | Show Up Battle Ready
   187â†’```
   188â†’
   189â†’---
   190â†’
   191â†’## Follow-Up Templates
   192â†’
   193â†’### Follow-Up 1: No Response After 5-7 Days
   194â†’
   195â†’```
   196â†’Hey [Name]! Just bumping this up in case it got lost in your DMs.
   197â†’Still would love to send you some Infinity Vault binders to check
   198â†’out. No rush, just didn't want the offer to slip through the cracks.
   199â†’Let me know!
   200â†’```
   201â†’
   202â†’### Follow-Up 2: No Response After 14 Days
   203â†’
   204â†’```
   205â†’Hey [Name] - last follow-up, I promise! I know creators get tons
   206â†’of messages. If you're interested in trying our battle-ready binders,
   207â†’the offer stands. If the timing isn't right, totally understand.
   208â†’Either way, keep creating great content!
   209â†’```
   210â†’
   211â†’### After They Respond Positively
   212â†’
   213â†’```
   214â†’That's awesome, [Name]! I'm stoked to get these in your hands.
   215â†’
   216â†’Here's what I'll send over:
   217â†’- 2x Infinity Vault Premium Trading Card Binders
   218â†’- A note with our brand story
   219â†’- [If applicable: Your unique affiliate link/code]
   220â†’
   221â†’Just drop me your shipping address and I'll get them out ASAP.
   222â†’
   223â†’Also, zero pressure on timeline for any content. Use them, enjoy
   224â†’them, and if they naturally fit into your content, that's the
   225â†’best kind of partnership.
   226â†’
   227â†’Looking forward to it!
   228â†’```
   229â†’
   230â†’---
   231â†’
   232â†’## Personalization Quick-Reference
   233â†’
   234â†’**To personalize each message, note these BEFORE sending:**
   235â†’
   236â†’| Field | What to Look For | Example |
   237â†’|-------|-----------------|---------|
   238â†’| `[specific video]` | Their most viewed or most recent relevant video | "your vintage Pokemon ETB opening from last week" |
   239â†’| `[specific moment]` | A genuine moment that stood out | "that reaction when you pulled the alt art Charizard" |
   240â†’| `[specific detail]` | Something unique about their content style | "the way you organize your binders by set" |
   241â†’| `[Name]` | Their display name or real name if known | |
   242â†’
   243â†’**Rule**: If you can't find at least one specific thing to reference, skip this creator or watch more of their content first. Generic outreach = ignored.
   244â†’
   245â†’---
   246â†’
   247â†’## Tracking Spreadsheet Headers
   248â†’
   249â†’Track all outreach in a spreadsheet:
   250â†’
   251â†’| Column | Purpose |
   252â†’|--------|---------|
   253â†’| TikTok Handle | @username |
   254â†’| Name | Real name if known |
   255â†’| Followers | Current count |
   256â†’| Engagement Rate | Calculated |
   257â†’| Content Niche | TCG/Pokemon/MTG/Gaming |

   262â†’| Follow-Up 1 | Date sent |
   263â†’| Follow-Up 2 | Date sent |
   264â†’| Response | Y/N |
   265â†’| Response Date | When they replied |

   - Goal (sales, awareness, testimonials)
   - Product type (toys, beauty, tech, etc.)
   - Experience level (beginner to advanced)

6. **TikTok Best Practices** - Production specs, posting strategy, hashtag strategy, caption tips

7. **Performance Tracking** - Success benchmarks and metrics to track

8. **A/B Testing Framework** - What to test and how to test systematically

   143â†’premium binders to try out. No strings attached - just one collector
   144â†’showing another collector some quality gear.

   228â†’```
   229â†’

entries.detail:
1â†’# TikTok Content Templates & Best Practices Library
     2â†’
     3â†’Build a library of proven TikTok content templates, hooks, and scripts optimized for e-commerce products. Include category-specific templates (toys & games initially) with A/B testing capability.
     4â†’
     5â†’## Rationale
     6â†’Reduces learning curve (addresses pain-4-5, pain-3-4) by providing ready-to-use templates. Encapsulates expertise so non-experts can create high-performing content. Supports saves-focused strategy.
     7â†’
     8â†’## User Stories
     9â†’- As a brand owner, I want proven content templates so that I don't have to figure out what works from scratch
    10â†’- As a content creator, I want hooks that work so that my videos get saved and drive purchases
    11â†’
    12â†’## Acceptance Criteria
    13â†’- [ ] 10+ TikTok hook templates categorized by content type
    14â†’- [ ] 5+ video script frameworks for product content
    15â†’- [ ] Template performance tracking with save rate correlation
    16â†’- [ ] Category filtering (toys & games, general e-commerce)
    17â†’- [ ] Easy template customization workflow
    18â†’- [ ] A/B test setup for template variants
    19â†’

1â†’# Product Demo Hooks - TikTok Templates
     2â†’
     3â†’## Hook Strategy for Product Demos
     4â†’
     5â†’**Goal**: Stop the scroll and make viewers curious about Infinity Vault binders in the first 1-3 seconds.
     6â†’
     7â†’**Approach**: Lead with the most visually interesting or emotionally resonant moment. Don't announce what the product isâ€”create curiosity that forces them to keep watching to find out.
     8â†’
     9â†’**Key Insight**: People don't scroll because they're not interested in binders. They scroll because the first second didn't give them a reason to care. Your hook's job is to make them care before they even know what they're looking at.
    10â†’
    11â†’---
    12â†’
    13â†’## Hook Template 1: The Scratch Test (Pattern Interrupt)
    14â†’
    15â†’**Category**: Pattern Interrupt
    16â†’
    17â†’**When to Use**:
    18â†’- Demonstrating scratch-resistant pages
    19â†’- Showing product durability
    20â†’- Differentiating from cheap binders
    21â†’
    22â†’**Hook**:
    23â†’```
    24â†’"I'm about to scratch a [$ amount] [card name] with this binder page..."
    25â†’```
    26â†’
    27â†’**Visual**: Camera focused on an expensive card, your hand holding it over the binder page, tension in the moment
    28â†’
    29â†’**Examples**:
    30â†’```
    31â†’"I'm about to scratch a $300 Charizard with this binder page..."
    32â†’
    33â†’"I'm about to scratch a $500 Pokemon card with this binder page..."
    34â†’
    35â†’"I'm about to rub a first edition Shadowless Charizard on this binder page..."
    36â†’
    37â†’"Watch me scratch this $400 card on purpose..."
    38â†’```
    39â†’
    40â†’**Why It Works**:
    41â†’- **Immediate tension** - Collectors instinctively cringe at the thought of scratching expensive cards
    42â†’- **Pattern interrupt** - Goes against everything collectors know (protect cards at all costs)
    43â†’- **Curiosity gap** - They HAVE to see what happens next
    44â†’- **Visual commitment** - You're literally showing the card and the page, making the threat real
    45â†’
    46â†’**Variations**:
    47â†’```
    48â†’"They told me this binder won't scratch cards... so I'm testing it with my most expensive card"
    49â†’
    50â†’"$400 Pokemon card + binder page = let's see what happens"
    51â†’
    52â†’"I paid $350 for this card. Now I'm going to drag it across this binder page."
    53â†’
    54â†’"Every collector's nightmare... I'm about to do it on purpose"
    55â†’```
    56â†’
    57â†’**Next Beat** (What comes after the hook):
    58â†’Show yourself deliberately rubbing the card against the page, then checking the card under light. Reveal that it's still perfect. Explain scratch-resistant pages.
    59â†’
    60â†’---
    61â†’
    62â†’## Hook Template 2: The Collection Reveal (Curiosity Gap)
    63â†’
    64â†’**Category**: Curiosity Gap
    65â†’
    66â†’**When to Use**:
    67â†’- Showing organized collection in binders
    68â†’- Demonstrating capacity/organization
    69â†’- Highlighting visual appeal of full binder
    70â†’
    71â†’**Hook**:
    72â†’```
    73â†’"I keep [$ amount] worth of [card type] in this binder..."
    74â†’```
    75â†’
    76â†’**Visual**: Close-up of binder exterior or your hand opening it, not showing contents yet
    77â†’
    78â†’**Examples**:
    79â†’```
    80â†’"I keep $10,000 worth of Pokemon cards in this binder..."
    81â†’
    82â†’"I have $5K in vintage Pokemon sitting in this binder right now..."
    83â†’
    84â†’"This binder holds my entire $8,000 tournament deck collection..."
    85â†’
    86â†’"$12,000 worth of graded cards... in this binder..."
    87â†’```
    88â†’
    89â†’**Why It Works**:
    90â†’- **Social proof** - If they trust it with that much value, it must be legit
    91â†’- **Curiosity** - They want to see what $10K in cards looks like
    92â†’- **Aspiration** - Target audience relates to protecting valuable collections
    93â†’- **Immediate credibility** - You're not selling, you're showing what you actually use
    94â†’
    95â†’**Variations**:
    96â†’```
    97â†’"My most valuable cards all live in this one binder..."
    98â†’
    99â†’"Every card in this binder is worth $100+..."
   100â†’
   101â†’"I trust this binder with cards I'd never trust to a regular binder..."
   102â†’
   103â†’"My entire tournament collection fits in here and I'm not worried"
   104â†’```
   105â†’
   106â†’**Next Beat** (What comes after the hook):
   107â†’Open the binder and show pages of organized cards. Point out specific valuable cards. Explain why you trust this binder with your collection.
   108â†’
   109â†’---
   110â†’
   111â†’## Hook Template 3: The Pain Point (Question Hook)
   112â†’
   113â†’**Category**: Question Hook
   114â†’
   115â†’**When to Use**:
   116â†’- Addressing common collector frustrations
   117â†’- Introducing the product as a solution
   118â†’- Targeting collectors who've had bad experiences
   119â†’
   120â†’**Hook**:
   121â†’```
   122â†’"Ever had a cheap binder scratch your [$ amount]+ card?"
   123â†’```
   124â†’
   125â†’**Visual**: Your face showing empathy/understanding, or a close-up of a scratched card
   126â†’
   127â†’**Examples**:
   128â†’```
   129â†’"Ever had a cheap binder scratch your $100+ card?"
   130â†’
   131â†’"Has a binder page ever scratched one of your chase cards?"
   132â†’
   133â†’"Ever pulled an expensive card just to have your binder damage it?"
   134â†’
   135â†’"You ever organize your collection and realize your binder scratched a card?"
   136â†’```
   137â†’
   138â†’**Why It Works**:
   139â†’- **Immediate identification** - Makes the target audience go "YES, that happened to me"
   140â†’- **Pain recall** - Reminds them of a frustrating experience
   141â†’- **Solution teaser** - Implies you have the answer
   142â†’- **Emotional connection** - Taps into shared collector trauma
   143â†’
   144â†’**Variations**:
   145â†’```
   146â†’"Show of hands: who's had a binder ruin a good card?"
   147â†’
   148â†’"Cheap binders and expensive cards don't mix... learned that the hard way"
   149â†’
   150â†’"That moment when you realize your binder scratched your chase card..."
   151â†’
   152â†’"Why do we spend hundreds on cards then put them in $10 binders?"
   153â†’```
   154â†’
   155â†’**Next Beat** (What comes after the hook):
   156â†’Acknowledge the pain ("Yeah, me too" or "I've seen it happen too many times"). Introduce Infinity Vault as the solution built specifically to prevent this.
   157â†’
   158â†’---
   159â†’
   160â†’## Hook Template 4: The Warranty Flex (Bold Statement)
   161â†’
   162â†’**Category**: Bold Statement
   163â†’
   164â†’**When to Use**:
   165â†’- Emphasizing lifetime warranty
   166â†’- Highlighting product confidence
   167â†’- Differentiating from competitors
   168â†’
   169â†’**Hook**:
   170â†’```
   171â†’"This binder has a lifetime warranty and I'm about to show you why"
   172â†’```
   173â†’
   174â†’**Visual**: Holding the binder confidently, direct eye contact with camera
   175â†’
   176â†’**Examples**:
   177â†’```
   178â†’"This binder has a lifetime warranty and I'm about to show you why"
   179â†’
   180â†’"Lifetime warranty on a binder... let me show you why they can promise that"
   181â†’
   182â†’"They're so confident in this binder they'll replace it forever if anything happens"
   183â†’
   184â†’"Lifetime warranty. On a binder. Watch this..."
   185â†’```
   186â†’
   187â†’**Why It Works**:
   188â†’- **Credibility signal** - Lifetime warranty = serious product quality
   189â†’- **Confidence** - The boldness of the claim demands proof
   190â†’- **Differentiation** - Most binders don't offer this
   191â†’- **Promise of demonstration** - "I'm about to show you" creates obligation to watch
   192â†’
   193â†’**Variations**:
   194â†’```
   195â†’"No binder company offers a lifetime warranty except these guys..."
   196â†’
   197â†’"Lifetime warranty on scratch-resistant pages... here's why"
   198â†’
   199â†’"They'll replace this binder for free. Forever. Here's the catch... there isn't one"
   200â†’
   201â†’"Why would a binder company offer a lifetime warranty? I was skeptical too..."
   202â†’```
   203â†’
   204â†’**Next Beat** (What comes after the hook):
   205â†’Demonstrate the features that make the warranty possible: scratch-resistant pages, durable construction, quality materials. Show close-ups of build quality.
   206â†’
   207â†’---
   208â†’
   209â†’## Hook Template 5: The Tournament Prep (Direct Address)
   210â†’
   211â†’**Category**: Direct Address
   212â†’
   213â†’**When to Use**:
   214â†’- Targeting competitive players
   215â†’- Showing tournament-ready organization
   216â†’- Highlighting portability and protection
   217â†’
   218â†’**Hook**:
   219â†’```
   220â†’"If you play [game] competitively, you need to see this binder..."
   221â†’```
   222â†’
   223â†’**Visual**: Tournament setting, deck boxes visible, or competition energy
   224â†’
   225â†’**Examples**:
   226â†’```
   227â†’"If you play Pokemon competitively, you need to see this binder..."
   228â†’
   229â†’"Tournament players: this is the binder I bring to every event"
   230â†’
   231â†’"If you've ever brought cards to a tournament, you need this..."
   232â†’
   233â†’"Competitive players know: your binder matters as much as your deck box"
   234â†’```
   235â†’
   236â†’**Why It Works**:
   237â†’- **Immediate targeting** - Calls out exactly who this is for
   238â†’- **Authority** - Positions you as someone in that competitive space
   239â†’- **Necessity language** - "need to see" creates urgency
   240â†’- **Community signal** - Speaking directly to a specific group
   241â†’
   242â†’**Variations**:
   243â†’```
   244â†’"Tournament players, stop using those cheap binders..."
   245â†’
   246â†’"If you've ever traded at a tournament, your binder is your first impression"
   247â†’
   248â†’"Every serious player I know uses one of these binders..."
   249â†’
   250â†’"Show up to the tournament with this and people notice"
   251â†’```
   252â†’
   253â†’**Next Beat** (What comes after the hook):
   254â†’Show the binder in a tournament context. Demonstrate organization, easy access to cards, and professional appearance. Connect to "Show Up Battle Ready" message.
   255â†’
   256â†’---
   257â†’
   258â†’## Hook Template 6: The Unboxing Moment (Curiosity Gap)
   259â†’
   260â†’**Category**: Curiosity Gap
   261â†’
   262â†’**When to Use**:
   263â†’- First impression content
   264â†’- Product reveal videos
   265â†’- Building anticipation
   266â†’
   267â†’**Hook**:
   268â†’```
   269â†’"I've been using [cheap binder brand] for years... just upgraded to this"
   270â†’```
   271â†’

1â†’# Product Demo Hooks - TikTok Templates
     2â†’
     3â†’## Hook Strategy for Product Demos
     4â†’
     5â†’**Goal**: Stop the scroll and make viewers curious about Infinity Vault binders in the first 1-3 seconds.
     6â†’
     7â†’**Approach**: Lead with the most visually interesting or emotionally resonant moment. Don't announce what the product isâ€”create curiosity that forces them to keep watching to find out.
     8â†’
     9â†’**Key Insight**: People don't scroll because they're not interested in binders. They scroll because the first second didn't give them a reason to care. Your hook's job is to make them care before they even know what they're looking at.
    10â†’
    11â†’---
    12â†’
    13â†’## Hook Template 1: The Scratch Test (Pattern Interrupt)
    14â†’
    15â†’**Category**: Pattern Interrupt
    16â†’
    17â†’**When to Use**:
    18â†’- Demonstrating scratch-resistant pages
    19â†’- Showing product durability
    20â†’- Differentiating from cheap binders
    21â†’
    22â†’**Hook**:
    23â†’```
    24â†’"I'm about to scratch a [$ amount] [card name] with this binder page..."
    25â†’```
    26â†’
    27â†’**Visual**: Camera focused on an expensive card, your hand holding it over the binder page, tension in the moment
    28â†’
    29â†’**Examples**:
    30â†’```
    31â†’"I'm about to scratch a $300 Charizard with this binder page..."
    32â†’
    33â†’"I'm about to scratch a $500 Pokemon card with this binder page..."
    34â†’
    35â†’"I'm about to rub a first edition Shadowless Charizard on this binder page..."
    36â†’
    37â†’"Watch me scratch this $400 card on purpose..."
    38â†’```
    39â†’
    40â†’**Why It Works**:
    41â†’- **Immediate tension** - Collectors instinctively cringe at the thought of scratching expensive cards
    42â†’- **Pattern interrupt** - Goes against everything collectors know (protect cards at all costs)
    43â†’- **Curiosity gap** - They HAVE to see what happens next
    44â†’- **Visual commitment** - You're literally showing the card and the page, making the threat real
    45â†’
    46â†’**Variations**:
    47â†’```
    48â†’"They told me this binder won't scratch cards... so I'm testing it with my most expensive card"
    49â†’
    50â†’"$400 Pokemon card + binder page = let's see what happens"
    51â†’
    52â†’"I paid $350 for this card. Now I'm going to drag it across this binder page."
    53â†’
    54â†’"Every collector's nightmare... I'm about to do it on purpose"
    55â†’```
    56â†’
    57â†’**Next Beat** (What comes after the hook):
    58â†’Show yourself deliberately rubbing the card against the page, then checking the card under light. Reveal that it's still perfect. Explain scratch-resistant pages.
    59â†’
    60â†’---
    61â†’
    62â†’## Hook Template 2: The Collection Reveal (Curiosity Gap)
    63â†’
    64â†’**Category**: Curiosity Gap
    65â†’
    66â†’**When to Use**:
    67â†’- Showing organized collection in binders
    68â†’- Demonstrating capacity/organization
    69â†’- Highlighting visual appeal of full binder
    70â†’
    71â†’**Hook**:
    72â†’```
    73â†’"I keep [$ amount] worth of [card type] in this binder..."
    74â†’```
    75â†’
    76â†’**Visual**: Close-up of binder exterior or your hand opening it, not showing contents yet
    77â†’
    78â†’**Examples**:
    79â†’```
    80â†’"I keep $10,000 worth of Pokemon cards in this binder..."
    81â†’
    82â†’"I have $5K in vintage Pokemon sitting in this binder right now..."
    83â†’
    84â†’"This binder holds my entire $8,000 tournament deck collection..."
    85â†’
    86â†’"$12,000 worth of graded cards... in this binder..."
    87â†’```
    88â†’
    89â†’**Why It Works**:
    90â†’- **Social proof** - If they trust it with that much value, it must be legit
    91â†’- **Curiosity** - They want to see what $10K in cards looks like
    92â†’- **Aspiration** - Target audience relates to protecting valuable collections
    93â†’- **Immediate credibility** - You're not selling, you're showing what you actually use
    94â†’
    95â†’**Variations**:
    96â†’```
    97â†’"My most valuable cards all live in this one binder..."
    98â†’
    99â†’"Every card in this binder is worth $100+..."
   100â†’
   101â†’"I trust this binder with cards I'd never trust to a regular binder..."
   102â†’
   103â†’"My entire tournament collection fits in here and I'm not worried"
   104â†’```
   105â†’
   106â†’**Next Beat** (What comes after the hook):
   107â†’Open the binder and show pages of organized cards. Point out specific valuable cards. Explain why you trust this binder with your collection.
   108â†’
   109â†’---
   110â†’
   111â†’## Hook Template 3: The Pain Point (Question Hook)
   112â†’
   113â†’**Category**: Question Hook
   114â†’
   115â†’**When to Use**:
   116â†’- Addressing common collector frustrations
   117â†’- Introducing the product as a solution
   118â†’- Targeting collectors who've had bad experiences
   119â†’
   120â†’**Hook**:
   121â†’```
   122â†’"Ever had a cheap binder scratch your [$ amount]+ card?"
   123â†’```
   124â†’
   125â†’**Visual**: Your face showing empathy/understanding, or a close-up of a scratched card
   126â†’
   127â†’**Examples**:
   128â†’```
   129â†’"Ever had a cheap binder scratch your $100+ card?"
   130â†’
   131â†’"Has a binder page ever scratched one of your chase cards?"
   132â†’
   133â†’"Ever pulled an expensive card just to have your binder damage it?"
   134â†’
   135â†’"You ever organize your collection and realize your binder scratched a card?"
   136â†’```
   137â†’
   138â†’**Why It Works**:
   139â†’- **Immediate identification** - Makes the target audience go "YES, that happened to me"
   140â†’- **Pain recall** - Reminds them of a frustrating experience
   141â†’- **Solution teaser** - Implies you have the answer
   142â†’- **Emotional connection** - Taps into shared collector trauma
   143â†’
   144â†’**Variations**:
   145â†’```
   146â†’"Show of hands: who's had a binder ruin a good card?"
   147â†’
   148â†’"Cheap binders and expensive cards don't mix... learned that the hard way"
   149â†’
   150â†’"That moment when you realize your binder scratched your chase card..."
   151â†’
   152â†’"Why do we spend hundreds on cards then put them in $10 binders?"
   153â†’```
   154â†’
   155â†’**Next Beat** (What comes after the hook):
   156â†’Acknowledge the pain ("Yeah, me too" or "I've seen it happen too many times"). Introduce Infinity Vault as the solution built specifically to prevent this.
   157â†’
   158â†’---
   159â†’
   160â†’## Hook Template 4: The Warranty Flex (Bold Statement)
   161â†’
   162â†’**Category**: Bold Statement
   163â†’
   164â†’**When to Use**:
   165â†’- Emphasizing lifetime warranty
   166â†’- Highlighting product confidence
   167â†’- Differentiating from competitors
   168â†’
   169â†’**Hook**:
   170â†’```
   171â†’"This binder has a lifetime warranty and I'm about to show you why"
   172â†’```
   173â†’
   174â†’**Visual**: Holding the binder confidently, direct eye contact with camera
   175â†’
   176â†’**Examples**:
   177â†’```
   178â†’"This binder has a lifetime warranty and I'm about to show you why"
   179â†’
   180â†’"Lifetime warranty on a binder... let me show you why they can promise that"
   181â†’
   182â†’"They're so confident in this binder they'll replace it forever if anything happens"
   183â†’
   184â†’"Lifetime warranty. On a binder. Watch this..."
   185â†’```
   186â†’
   187â†’**Why It Works**:
   188â†’- **Credibility signal** - Lifetime warranty = serious product quality
   189â†’- **Confidence** - The boldness of the claim demands proof
   190â†’- **Differentiation** - Most binders don't offer this
   191â†’- **Promise of demonstration** - "I'm about to show you" creates obligation to watch
   192â†’
   193â†’**Variations**:
   194â†’```
   195â†’"No binder company offers a lifetime warranty except these guys..."
   196â†’
   197â†’"Lifetime warranty on scratch-resistant pages... here's why"
   198â†’
   199â†’"They'll replace this binder for free. Forever. Here's the catch... there isn't one"
   200â†’
   201â†’"Why would a binder company offer a lifetime warranty? I was skeptical too..."
   202â†’```
   203â†’
   204â†’**Next Beat** (What comes after the hook):
   205â†’Demonstrate the features that make the warranty possible: scratch-resistant pages, durable construction, quality materials. Show close-ups of build quality.
   206â†’
   207â†’---
   208â†’
   209â†’## Hook Template 5: The Tournament Prep (Direct Address)
   210â†’
   211â†’**Category**: Direct Address
   212â†’
   213â†’**When to Use**:
   214â†’- Targeting competitive players
   215â†’- Showing tournament-ready organization
   216â†’- Highlighting portability and protection
   217â†’
   218â†’**Hook**:
   219â†’```
   220â†’"If you play [game] competitively, you need to see this binder..."
   221â†’```
   222â†’
   223â†’**Visual**: Tournament setting, deck boxes visible, or competition energy
   224â†’
   225â†’**Examples**:
   226â†’```
   227â†’"If you play Pokemon competitively, you need to see this binder..."
   228â†’
   229â†’"Tournament players: this is the binder I bring to every event"
   230â†’
   231â†’"If you've ever brought cards to a tournament, you need this..."
   232â†’
   233â†’"Competitive players know: your binder matters as much as your deck box"
   234â†’```
   235â†’
   236â†’**Why It Works**:
   237â†’- **Immediate targeting** - Calls out exactly who this is for
   238â†’- **Authority** - Positions you as someone in that competitive space
   239â†’- **Necessity language** - "need to see" creates urgency
   240â†’- **Community signal** - Speaking directly to a specific group
   241â†’
   242â†’**Variations**:
   243â†’```
   244â†’"Tournament players, stop using those cheap binders..."
   245â†’
   246â†’"If you've ever traded at a tournament, your binder is your first impression"
   247â†’
   248â†’"Every serious player I know uses one of these binders..."
   249â†’
   250â†’"Show up to the tournament with this and people notice"
   251â†’```
   252â†’
   253â†’**Next Beat** (What comes after the hook):
   254â†’Show the binder in a tournament context. Demonstrate organization, easy access to cards, and professional appearance. Connect to "Show Up Battle Ready" message.
   255â†’
   256â†’---
   257â†’
   258â†’## Hook Template 6: The Unboxing Moment (Curiosity Gap)
   259â†’
   260â†’**Category**: Curiosity Gap
   261â†’
   262â†’**When to Use**:
   263â†’- First impression content
   264â†’- Product reveal videos
   265â†’- Building anticipation
   266â†’
   267â†’**Hook**:
   268â†’```
   269â†’"I've been using [cheap binder brand] for years... just upgraded to this"
   270â†’```
   271â†’

     3â†’Build a library of proven TikTok content templates, hooks, and scripts optimized for e-commerce products. Include category-specific templates (toys & games initially) with A/B testing capability.
     4â†’
     5â†’## Rationale
     6â†’Reduces learning curve (addresses pain-4-5, pain-3-4) by providing ready-to-use templates. Encapsulates expertise so non-experts can create high-performing content. Supports saves-focused strategy.
     7â†’
     8â†’## User Stories
     9â†’- As a brand owner, I want proven content templates so that I don't have to figure out what works from scratch
    10â†’- As a content creator, I want hooks that work so that my videos get saved and drive purchases
    11â†’
    12â†’## Acceptance Criteria
    13â†’- [ ] 10+ TikTok hook templates categorized by content type
    14â†’- [ ] 5+ video script frameworks for product content
    15â†’- [ ] Template performance tracking with save rate correlation
    16â†’- [ ] Category filtering (toys & games, general e-commerce)
    17â†’- [ ] Easy template customization workflow
    18â†’- [ ] A/B test setup for template variants
    19â†’

   209â†’## Hook Template 5: The Tournament Prep (Direct Address)
   210â†’
   211â†’**Category**: Direct Address
   212â†’
   213â†’**When to Use**:
   214â†’- Targeting competitive players
   215â†’- Showing tournament-ready organization
   216â†’- Highlighting portability and protection
   217â†’
   218â†’**Hook**:
   219â†’```
   220â†’"If you play [game] competitively, you need to see this binder..."
   221â†’```
   222â†’
   223â†’**Visual**: Tournament setting, deck boxes visible, or competition energy
   224â†’
   225â†’**Examples**:
   226â†’```
   227â†’"If you play Pokemon competitively, you need to see this binder..."
   228â†’
   229â†’"Tournament players: this is the binder I bring to every event"
   230â†’
   231â†’"If you've ever brought cards to a tournament, you need this..."
   232â†’
   233â†’"Competitive players know: your binder matters as much as your deck box"
   234â†’```
   235â†’
   236â†’**Why It Works**:
   237â†’- **Immediate targeting** - Calls out exactly who this is for
   238â†’- **Authority** - Positions you as someone in that competitive space
   239â†’- **Necessity language** - "need to see" creates urgency
   240â†’- **Community signal** - Speaking directly to a specific group
   241â†’
   242â†’**Variations**:
   243â†’```
   244â†’"Tournament players, stop using those cheap binders..."
   245â†’
   246â†’"If you've ever traded at a tournament, your binder is your first impression"
   247â†’
   248â†’"Every serious player I know uses one of these binders..."
   249â†’
   250â†’"Show up to the tournament with this and people notice"
   251â†’```
   252â†’
   253â†’**Next Beat** (What comes after the hook):
   254â†’Show the binder in a tournament context. Demonstrate organization, easy access to cards, and professional appearance. Connect to "Show Up Battle Ready" message.
   255â†’
   256â†’---
   257â†’
   258â†’## Hook Template 6: The Unboxing Moment (Curiosity Gap)
   259â†’
   260â†’**Category**: Curiosity Gap
   261â†’
   262â†’**When to Use**:
   263â†’- First impression content
   264â†’- Product reveal videos
   265â†’- Building anticipation
   266â†’
   267â†’**Hook**:
   268â†’```
   269â†’"I've been using [cheap binder brand] for years... just upgraded to this"
   270â†’```
   271â†’

1â†’# TikTok Content Hooks Library
     2â†’
     3â†’## What Are Hooks?
     4â†’
     5â†’**Hooks** are the critical first 1-3 seconds of your TikTok video that determine whether viewers keep watching or scroll away. On TikTok, you have less than one second to capture attention before someone swipes to the next video.
     6â†’
     7â†’**The Hook's Job**: Stop the scroll. Create curiosity. Make them want to see what happens next.
     8â†’
     9â†’---
    10â†’
    11â†’## Why Hooks Matter
    12â†’
    13â†’TikTok's algorithm rewards watch time and completion rate. A strong hook:
    14â†’- **Stops the scroll** - Grabs attention instantly
    15â†’- **Increases watch time** - More viewers stay to the end
    16â†’- **Boosts engagement** - Better retention = more likes, comments, shares
    17â†’- **Gets algorithm love** - Higher completion rates = more reach
    18â†’
    19â†’**Reality**: Even the best product demo fails without a strong hook. Your first second is everything.
    20â†’
    21â†’---
    22â†’
    23â†’## Hook Categories
    24â†’
    25â†’This library organizes hooks by content type:
    26â†’
    27â†’### [Product Demos](./product-demos.md)
    28â†’Hooks for showcasing Infinity Vault binders in action
    29â†’- **Use for**: Feature demonstrations, unboxings, first impressions
    30â†’- **Goal**: Make viewers want to see the product in action
    31â†’
    32â†’### Educational Content *(Coming Soon)*
    33â†’Hooks for teaching TCG tips, tricks, and best practices
    34â†’- **Use for**: How-to content, tutorials, educational videos
    35â†’- **Goal**: Promise valuable knowledge or insight
    36â†’
    37â†’### Trend Hijacks *(Coming Soon)*
    38â†’Hooks for jumping on trending sounds and formats
    39â†’- **Use for**: Participating in viral trends with brand relevance
    40â†’- **Goal**: Leverage existing momentum for visibility
    41â†’
    42â†’### Storytelling *(Coming Soon)*
    43â†’Hooks for narrative-driven content
    44â†’- **Use for**: Brand story, customer testimonials, behind-the-scenes
    45â†’- **Goal**: Create emotional connection and relatability
    46â†’
    47â†’### Problem/Solution *(Coming Soon)*
    48â†’Hooks highlighting pain points that your product solves
    49â†’- **Use for**: Pain point â†’ solution content
    50â†’- **Goal**: Make viewers identify with the problem instantly
    51â†’
    52â†’---
    53â†’
    54â†’## Hook Formula Framework
    55â†’
    56â†’Every strong TikTok hook follows one of these proven patterns:
    57â†’
    58â†’### 1. **Pattern Interrupt**
    59â†’Break expectations immediately. Do or say something unexpected.
    60â†’- Example: *"I scratched a $500 Pokemon card... on purpose"*
    61â†’
    62â†’### 2. **Bold Statement**
    63â†’Make a claim that demands explanation.
    64â†’- Example: *"This binder has a lifetime warranty and I'm about to show you why"*
    65â†’
    66â†’### 3. **Question Hook**
    67â†’Ask a question that makes your target audience say "yes, me!"
    68â†’- Example: *"Ever had a cheap binder scratch your favorite card?"*
    69â†’
    70â†’### 4. **Direct Address**
    71â†’Call out your specific audience immediately.
    72â†’- Example: *"If you've ever spent $100+ on a single card, this is for you"*
    73â†’
    74â†’### 5. **Curiosity Gap**
    75â†’Tease something interesting without revealing it yet.
    76â†’- Example: *"I'm about to show you the only binder I trust with my graded cards"*
    77â†’
    78â†’### 6. **Social Proof**
    79â†’Lead with a result or achievement.
    80â†’- Example: *"After scratching three cards with cheap binders, I finally found this"*
    81â†’
    82â†’---
    83â†’
    84â†’## How to Use These Templates
    85â†’
    86â†’### Step 1: Choose Your Content Type
    87â†’What kind of video are you making? Pick the appropriate hook category.
    88â†’
    89â†’### Step 2: Select a Hook Template
    90â†’Browse the templates in that category. Choose one that matches your video's angle.
    91â†’
    92â†’### Step 3: Customize for Your Video
    93â†’Replace placeholder text with specifics relevant to your exact video content.
    94â†’
    95â†’### Step 4: Test and Iterate
    96â†’- Try different hooks on similar content
    97â†’- Track which hooks get the best watch time
    98â†’- Double down on what works for your audience
    99â†’
   100â†’---
   101â†’
   102â†’## Hook Writing Best Practices
   103â†’
   104â†’### Do's âœ…
   105â†’- **Keep it short** - 1-3 seconds max
   106â†’- **Use power words** - "Never," "Always," "Secret," "Mistake"
   107â†’- **Create curiosity** - Make them need to see what's next
   108â†’- **Be specific** - "This binder" beats "This product"
   109â†’- **Match your energy** - Your tone should fit your audience
   110â†’- **Front-load value** - Lead with the benefit or payoff
   111â†’
   112â†’### Don'ts âŒ
   113â†’- **Don't bury the hook** - No long intros or setup
   114â†’- **Don't be vague** - "Check this out" tells them nothing
   115â†’- **Don't oversell** - Authenticity > hype
   116â†’- **Don't use filler words** - "So basically" wastes precious seconds
   117â†’- **Don't copy exactly** - Adapt templates to your voice
   118â†’
   119â†’---
   120â†’
   121â†’## Testing Your Hooks
   122â†’
   123â†’### A/B Test Your Hooks
   124â†’Post the same video content with different hooks and track:
   125â†’- **Watch time** - How long viewers stay
   126â†’- **Completion rate** - % who watch to the end
   127â†’- **Engagement rate** - Likes, comments, shares
   128â†’- **Share rate** - Strongest signal of value
   129â†’
   130â†’### Winning Hook Indicators
   131â†’A hook is working when:
   132â†’- âœ… 50%+ completion rate
   133â†’- âœ… Above-average comments asking questions
   134â†’- âœ… Higher shares than usual
   135â†’- âœ… Strong watch time in first 3 seconds
   136â†’
   137â†’### Red Flags
   138â†’Kill or revise hooks that show:
   139â†’- âŒ Drop-off in first 2 seconds
   140â†’- âŒ Low completion rate despite good content
   141â†’- âŒ Confused comments asking "what is this?"
   142â†’- âŒ Low share rate
   143â†’
   144â†’---
   145â†’
   146â†’## Hook Template Structure
   147â†’
   148â†’Each template in this library includes:
   149â†’
   150â†’| Element | Description |
   151â†’|---------|-------------|
   152â†’| **Hook Category** | Pattern type (Pattern Interrupt, Question, etc.) |
   153â†’| **When to Use** | Best use case scenarios |
   154â†’| **Template** | The actual hook language with [placeholders] |
   155â†’| **Example** | Real-world usage with Infinity Vault products |
   156â†’| **Why It Works** | Psychology and strategy behind the hook |
   157â†’| **Variations** | Alternative ways to phrase the same hook |
   158â†’
   159â†’---
   160â†’
   161â†’## Quick Reference: Hook by Goal
   162â†’
   163â†’| Your Goal | Best Hook Pattern | Example Category |
   164â†’|-----------|------------------|------------------|
   165â†’| Show product feature | Pattern Interrupt | Product Demos |
   166â†’| Teach something | Curiosity Gap | Educational |
   167â†’| Join a trend | Direct Address | Trend Hijacks |
   168â†’| Share a story | Social Proof | Storytelling |
   169â†’| Solve a problem | Question Hook | Problem/Solution |
   170â†’
   171â†’---
   172â†’
   173â†’*"Your hook isn't just the first thing they see. It's the only thing that decides if they'll see anything else."*
   174â†’

1â†’# Unboxing Framework - TikTok Script Template
     2â†’
     3â†’## Framework Overview
     4â†’
     5â†’**Purpose**: Create anticipation and showcase product quality through an engaging unboxing experience that builds excitement and trust.
     6â†’
     7â†’**Best Used For**:
     8â†’- New product launches or reveals
     9â†’- First impression content
    10â†’- Packaging quality demonstrations
    11â†’- Building excitement for premium products
    12â†’- Creating "I need that" moments
    13â†’
    14â†’**Target Audience**:
    15â†’- Potential customers evaluating quality
    16â†’- Existing customers curious about new products
    17â†’- Collectors interested in presentation value
    18â†’- Anyone on the fence about premium pricing
    19â†’
    20â†’**Typical Length**: 30-45 seconds
    21â†’
    22â†’**Conversion Goal**: Saves (for reference when ready to buy) and link clicks
    23â†’
    24â†’---
    25â†’
    26â†’## Why Unboxing Content Works
    27â†’
    28â†’### Psychological Triggers
    29â†’1. **Anticipation** - Unboxing taps into the joy of discovery
    30â†’2. **Social proof** - "They're excited about it, maybe I should be too"
    31â†’3. **Quality signals** - Premium packaging = premium product
    32â†’4. **Vicarious experience** - Viewers experience the unboxing with you
    33â†’5. **FOMO** - Creates desire to have that same experience
    34â†’
    35â†’### TikTok-Specific Advantages
    36â†’- **High completion rate** - Natural narrative arc keeps viewers watching
    37â†’- **Satisfying payoff** - The reveal creates dopamine hit
    38â†’- **Shareable** - "Look at this cool thing" content spreads easily
    39â†’- **Repeatable** - Can unbox different products or variations
    40â†’
    41â†’---
    42â†’
    43â†’## Complete Script Structure (45-Second Version)
    44â†’
    45â†’### Timing Breakdown
    46â†’
    47â†’| Time | Section | Focus | Visual |
    48â†’|------|---------|-------|--------|
    49â†’| **0-3s** | Hook | Stop scroll, create curiosity | Closed box/package |
    50â†’| **3-8s** | Packaging First Impression | Build anticipation | Opening sequence |
    51â†’| **8-18s** | First Touch/Reveal | Emotional reaction | Product reveal |
    52â†’| **18-35s** | Feature Highlights | Value demonstration | Close-up details |
    53â†’| **35-40s** | Credibility Signal | Trust building | Key differentiator |
    54â†’| **40-45s** | Call-to-Action | Direct next step | Product in use/final shot |
    55â†’
    56â†’---
    57â†’
    58â†’## Beat-by-Beat Script Template
    59â†’
    60â†’### Beat 1: The Hook (0-3 seconds)
    61â†’
    62â†’**Purpose**: Stop the scroll with curiosity or bold statement
    63â†’
    64â†’**Script Options**:
    65â†’```
    66â†’OPTION A (Curiosity Gap):
    67â†’"I've been using [cheap alternative] for years... just upgraded to this"
    68â†’
    69â†’OPTION B (Bold Statement):
    70â†’"Unboxing the binder everyone in the TCG community is talking about"
    71â†’
    72â†’OPTION C (Value Hook):
    73â†’"$40 for a binder seemed crazy until I opened it..."
    74â†’
    75â†’OPTION D (Social Proof):
    76â†’"After my third scratched card, I finally bought this binder"
    77â†’```
    78â†’
    79â†’**Visual**:
    80â†’- Close-up of unopened package/box
    81â†’- Your hand about to open it
    82â†’- Slight movement/anticipation energy
    83â†’- Good lighting on packaging
    84â†’
    85â†’**Delivery Tips**:
    86â†’- Speak with genuine excitement or curiosity
    87â†’- Make eye contact with camera
    88â†’- Don't announce brand name yet (save for later)
    89â†’
    90â†’---
    91â†’
    92â†’### Beat 2: Packaging First Impression (3-8 seconds)
    93â†’
    94â†’**Purpose**: Build anticipation while signaling quality
    95â†’
    96â†’**Script Template**:
    97â†’```
    98â†’"[First impression of packaging quality]... [builds anticipation]"
    99â†’
   100â†’EXAMPLES:
   101â†’"Okay, packaging quality already tells me this isn't a cheap binder..."
   102â†’
   103â†’"The box itself feels premium... this is a good sign"
   104â†’
   105â†’"They packed this really well... let's see if the product matches"
   106â†’
   107â†’"Even the unboxing experience is thoughtful... I'm impressed already"
   108â†’```
   109â†’
   110â†’**Visual**:
   111â†’- Hands opening packaging
   112â†’- Close-up of packaging details
   113â†’- Smooth, deliberate movements
   114â†’- Reveal protective elements (tissue paper, inserts, etc.)
   115â†’
   116â†’**Delivery Tips**:
   117â†’- Share genuine first impressions
   118â†’- Point out specific quality indicators
   119â†’- Build anticipation without overhyping
   120â†’
   121â†’---
   122â†’
   123â†’### Beat 3: The First Touch/Reveal (8-18 seconds)
   124â†’
   125â†’**Purpose**: Deliver emotional payoff and genuine reaction
   126â†’
   127â†’**Script Template**:
   128â†’```
   129â†’"[Reaction to seeing/touching product] + [First quality observation]"
   130â†’
   131â†’EXAMPLES:
   132â†’"Whoa... okay, this is not what I expected. The material quality is insane."
   133â†’
   134â†’"First thing I notice: the pages feel completely different from regular binders."
   135â†’
   136â†’"The weight of this... it feels substantial. This is built to last."
   137â†’
   138â†’"Okay I need to feel these pages... *touches* ...yeah, this is way different."
   139â†’```
   140â†’
   141â†’**Visual**:
   142â†’- Product reveal moment
   143â†’- Your genuine reaction (face on camera)
   144â†’- First touch/handling of product
   145â†’- Show texture, weight, or key features
   146â†’- Good lighting on product details
   147â†’
   148â†’**Pro Tip**: This is your "wow" moment. Make it genuine. Forced excitement kills trust.
   149â†’
   150â†’**Delivery Tips**:
   151â†’- React authentically (viewers can tell if it's fake)
   152â†’- Hold product at good angles for camera
   153â†’- Slow down slightly - let them see details
   154â†’- Use tactile language ("feel," "smooth," "solid")
   155â†’
   156â†’---
   157â†’
   158â†’### Beat 4: Feature Highlights (18-35 seconds)
   159â†’
   160â†’**Purpose**: Demonstrate value and justify premium price
   161â†’
   162â†’**Script Template**:
   163â†’```
   164â†’"[Key Feature 1] + [Why it matters] â†’ [Key Feature 2] + [Why it matters]"
   165â†’
   166â†’EXAMPLES:
   167â†’"These are scratch-resistant pages, which means my expensive cards are actually protected.
   168â†’And it has a lifetime warranty... they're that confident it won't fall apart."
   169â†’
   170â†’"160 pages... that's way more than standard binders.
   171â†’Plus look at these side-loading pockets... cards slide in so smoothly."
   172â†’
   173â†’"The zipper is dual-sided for extra security, and the material is water-resistant.
   174â†’This is basically a vault for your collection."
   175â†’
   176â†’"Check out the stitching on this... this is built to last years, not months.
   177â†’And the ring mechanism is buttery smooth."
   178â†’```
   179â†’
   180â†’**Visual**:
   181â†’- Close-ups of each feature mentioned
   182â†’- Demonstrate functionality (zipper, pages, rings)
   183â†’- Side-by-side with cheaper alternative (if available)
   184â†’- Show scale/capacity
   185â†’
   186â†’**Delivery Tips**:
   187â†’- Lead with feature, follow with benefit
   188â†’- Use comparisons ("unlike cheap binders...")
   189â†’- Show, don't just tell
   190â†’- Max 2-3 features (don't overwhelm)
   191â†’
   192â†’---
   193â†’
   194â†’### Beat 5: Credibility Signal (35-40 seconds)
   195â†’
   196â†’**Purpose**: Address skepticism and build trust
   197â†’
   198â†’**Script Template**:
   199â†’```
   200â†’"[Why you trust this product] or [What convinced you] or [Social proof]"
   201â†’
   202â†’EXAMPLES:
   203â†’"I keep $5,000 worth of cards in my collection... this is the only binder I'd trust them in."
   204â†’
   205â†’"Three of my tournament buddies use these and I finally get why."
   206â†’
   207â†’"I've been using cheap binders for years and scratched too many cards. Never again."
   208â†’
   209â†’"The lifetime warranty is no joke... if anything happens, they replace it free."
   210â†’```
   211â†’
   212â†’**Visual**:
   213â†’- Show product in context (holding your valuable cards, etc.)
   214â†’- Your face (builds trust through eye contact)
   215â†’- Comparison to previous solution if relevant
   216â†’
   217â†’**Delivery Tips**:
   218â†’- Be honest about hesitations or concerns you had
   219â†’- Share why this overcame those concerns
   220â†’- Use specific details (not vague claims)
   221â†’
   222â†’---
   223â†’
   224â†’### Beat 6: Call-to-Action (40-45 seconds)
   225â†’
   226â†’**Purpose**: Direct viewers to next step with clear motivation
   227â†’
   228â†’**Script Template**:
   229â†’```
   230â†’"[Specific action] + [Why they should do it]"
   231â†’
   232â†’EXAMPLES:
   233â†’"Link's in my bio if you're tired of cheap binders scratching your cards."
   234â†’
   235â†’"Save this video for when you're ready to upgrade your binder game."
   236â†’
   237â†’"If you've ever scratched an expensive card, you need to check this out. Link in bio."
   238â†’
   239â†’"Follow me for more TCG product reviews... I'm testing this for 30 days."
   240â†’```
   241â†’
   242â†’**Visual**:
   243â†’- Product in use or final glamour shot
   244â†’- Your face with confident energy
   245â†’- Text overlay with CTA if possible
   246â†’
   247â†’**Pro Tips**:
   248â†’- Make CTA specific ("save this" vs. "check it out")
   249â†’- Give them a reason to act ("if you've ever..." creates relevance)
   250â†’- Don't ask for multiple actions (pick one: save, click, follow)
   251â†’
   252â†’**Delivery Tips**:
   253â†’- End with energy (don't fade out)
   254â†’- Make eye contact

   271â†’
   272â†’**Visual Pacing**: Change shots every 3-5 seconds to maintain engagement
   273â†’
